title.value: Calibration-free parallel transmission of the cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spinal cord at 7T
title.justification: The title is explicit about the research focus on a calibration-free parallel transmission application.
title.quote: Calibration-free parallel transmission of the cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spinal cord at 7T

extractions.description: This paper addresses the limitations of spinal cord imaging at ultra-high field MRI (7T) by introducing a calibration-free parallel transmission method. It employs universal RF shims to enhance imaging efficiency across various spinal cord regions, offering a significant advancement in reducing time-consuming adjustments.

type.justification: The paper involves practical implementation and testing of MRI techniques and devices, such as RF shims and high-resolution imaging.
type.quote: In this in-vivo study, we investigate the feasibility and benefits of using universal RF shims (US) to optimize the B+1 transmit and B+1 efficiency profiles in the cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spine.

name.justification: The paper focuses on improving MRI techniques for spinal cord imaging at ultra-high field strengths.
name.quote: Ultra-high field MRI (UHF; ≥ 7T) has revolutionized the field of human neuroimaging, offering unprecedented spatial resolution and contrast compared to MRI scanners operating at lower field strengths.

name.justification: The study leverages parallel transmission techniques to improve MRI efficiency.
name.quote: This study introduces calibration-free offline computed universal shim modes that can be applied seamlessly for different pTx RF coils and spinal cord target regions, substantially enhancing spinal cord imaging efficiency at UHF.

name.justification: The research specifically focuses on imaging various regions of the spinal cord at high field strengths.
name.quote: This study introduces calibration-free offline computed universal shim modes that can be applied seamlessly for different pTx RF coils and spinal cord target regions, substantially enhancing spinal cord imaging efficiency at UHF.

name.justification: The universal RF shims are a central contribution of the paper, designed to improve MRI efficiencies without calibration.
name.quote: This study introduces calibration-free offline computed universal shim modes that can be applied seamlessly for different pTx RF coils and spinal cord target regions.

is_contributed.justification: The universal RF shims are an innovative contribution of this research as a novel MRI technique.
is_contributed.quote: The development of universal shims represents a significant advance by eliminating time-consuming subject-specific pTx adjustments.

is_executed.justification: The focus is on the development and testing of shims rather than computational execution using GPUs or CPUs.
is_executed.quote: The development of universal shims represents a significant advance by eliminating time-consuming subject-specific pTx adjustments.

is_compared.justification: The shims are compared to traditional methods, assessing improvements in efficiency and imaging quality.
is_compared.quote: The proposed universal shims demonstrated a 50% improvement in B+1 efficiency compared to the default (zero phase) shim mode.

referenced_paper_title.value: Universal pulses: a new concept for calibration-free parallel transmission
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference is cited as the basis for extending the universal shim concept to the spinal cord in the current study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The challenge of optimizing RF pulses for individual subjects has been effectively addressed by pre-computed dynamic universal pTx pulses (UP) in the human brain.

name.value: B+1 Maps for Cervical, Thoracic, and Lumbar Spine
name.justification: Datasets of B+1 maps are used to develop and validate the universal shims.
name.quote: A library of channel-wise relative B+1 maps for the cervical spinal cord (six datasets) and thoracic and lumbar spinal cord (nine datasets) was constructed.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The datasets were constructed and used in the study, but not cited from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A library of channel-wise relative B+1 maps for the cervical spinal cord (six datasets) and thoracic and lumbar spinal cord (nine datasets) was constructed.

name.justification: MATLAB was used for most of the computational work related to MR data processing and RF shim design.
name.quote: All other tasks were performed in MATLAB (The MathWorks, Natick, MA).

referenced_paper_title.justification: MATLAB is a common computational tool, not requiring citation to specific research papers.
referenced_paper_title.quote: All other tasks were performed in MATLAB (The MathWorks, Natick, MA).

name.justification: Python was used specifically for the tailored ΔB0 shimming portion of the methodology.
name.quote: Besides tailored ΔB0 shimming, which was performed in Python, all other tasks were performed in MATLAB.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Python scripting is a typical part of data processing and does not require specific citations.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Besides tailored ΔB0 shimming, which was performed in Python, all other tasks were performed in MATLAB.
